activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Ruesch

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge re: hearing date

2:01 PM Defendant Michael A. Ruesch appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Michael A. Ruesch. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Laufenberg willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Laufenberg states still in negotiations - may file a collateral attack. Bond continued. adj. 02:04 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael A. Ruesch appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Michael A. Ruesch. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Laufenberg requests pre-tiral be set. Bail continued. Adj. 02:53 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
